instruction: Recommend a set of process parameters for fabricating a perovskite solar cell with an open circuit voltage (VOC) of 1.141eV.
chosen: The perovskite precursor solution, with a composition of Cs0.05MA0.1FA0.85Pb1I3.0 and a concentration of 1.73 M, was prepared by mixing with MACl (14.6 mg/mL); PEAI (0.517 mg/mL) and Me-4PACz (0.198 mg/mL) 4PADCB (0.066 mg/mL) Me-2PACz (0.066 mg/mL). The mixed solution was deposited via a two-step spin-coating process: first at 1000 rpm for 10 s, then at 5000 rpm for 40 s. 160 μL of antisolvent was dropped 10 seconds before the end of the second spin step. The film was annealed at 110 °C for 25 s. Subsequently, a passivation treatment was carried out using PEAI (1.0 mg/mL); PDADI (0.5 mg/mL); m-f-PEAI (2.0 mg/mL), spin-coated at 5000 rpm for 32 s with 130 μL of solution dropped 10 s after spin start. The film was then annealed at 100 °C for 5 min.
rejected: The perovskite precursor solution, with a composition of Cs0.05MA0.1FA0.85Pb1I3.0 and a concentration of 1.73 M, was prepared by mixing with MACl (14.6 mg/mL); PEAI (0.517 mg/mL) and Me-4PACz (0.188571429 mg/mL) DMACPA (0.125714286 mg/mL) 4-ABnP (0.015714286 mg/mL). The mixed solution was deposited via a two-step spin-coating process: first at 1000 rpm for 10 s, then at 5000 rpm for 40 s. 160 μL of antisolvent was dropped 10 seconds before the end of the second spin step. The film was annealed at 110 °C for 25 s. Subsequently, a passivation treatment was carried out using PEAI (1.0 mg/mL); PDADI (0.5 mg/mL), spin-coated at 5000 rpm for 33 s with 100 μL of solution dropped 11 s after spin start. The film was then annealed at 100 °C for 6 min.
